p: Rearing was carried out at the temperature of 25 ± 1 °C and photoperiod of 16 h dark: 8 h light. Relative humidity (RH) varied depending on the instar; first instar: RH 85 ± 5%, second instar: 80 ± 5%, third instar: 75 ± 5%, fourth instar: 70 ± 5%, fifth instar: 65 ± 5%. RH was lowered to 60 ± 5% during the moulting period to permit diet desiccation. Larvae of both the strains were fed with two feeding substrates: fresh M. alba leaves of the Florio cultivar and a commercial artificial diet according to [ 25].
